attributes.action: Demand the end to the execution of juveniles in Iran.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Despite the outrage caused by the public execution of 16 year-old Atqam Rajabi for 'acts contrary to chastity' in 2004 the execution of under 18s continue. At least 12 in the next two years.  
This is contrary to the wishes of Iranian legislators and Iran's international commitments.
In 2003 the Iranian parliament voted to abolish the death penalty for under 18s but this was overturned by the Council of Guardians as being contrary 'to Islamic purity' which sets minimum execution ages at 13 for boys and nine for girls.
Iran is also party to the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child which forbids any death sentence on those who were under 18 when the offence happened.
